parameters.title: Global regions, apart from the earth itself
parameters.label: Global regions include regions that cover more than one continent, usually girdling the Earth.

parameters.title: Continental landmasses
parameters.label: Pancontinental include Americas, Eurasia, Africa, Australia, Oceania and Antarctica.

parameters.title: Panoceanic regions, covering more than one ocean
parameters.label: Panoceanic regions include the Arctic, North Atlantic, Indian, Pacific and Antarctic oceans.

parameters.title: The classical 7 continents
parameters.label: Continental include North America, South America, Europe, Asia, Africa, Oceania and Antarctica

parameters.title: The classical 7 continents, including marine regions
parameters.label: Marine Continental include North America, South America, Europe, Asia, Africa, Oceania and Antarctica

parameters.title: Oceanic regions, covering more than one ocean
parameters.label: Oceanic regions include the Arctic, North Atlantic, South Atlantic, Indian, North Pacific, South Pacific and Antarctic oceans .

parameters.title: Regions with subcontinental coverage, covering more than one country
parameters.label: Subcontinental regions cover arbitrary regions, defined by e.g. political, climatic or topographic conditions

parameters.title: Regions with subcontinental coverage, covering more than one country
parameters.label: Subcontinental regions cover arbitrary regions, defined by e.g. political, climatic or topographic conditions

parameters.title: Regions with suboceanic coverage, including enclosed seas
parameters.label: Suboceanic regions cover both defined enclosed seas as well as other oceanic regions falling within a single of the seven classical oceans

parameters.title: Regions with hydrological basin coverage
parameters.label: The basin region category contains the worlds hydrological basins (watersheds)

parameters.title: Regions with hydrological subasin coverage
parameters.label: The subbasin region category contains subbasins of basins (watersheds)

parameters.title: Sovereign (composite) nation states
parameters.label: Sovereign (composite) nation states

parameters.title: Country
parameters.label: Country (usually with recognized iso-code)

parameters.title: Country incl maritime area
parameters.label: Country incl maritime area (usually with recognized iso-code)

parameters.title: Country, or part of country, falling within one of the classical 7 continents
parameters.label: Transcontinental countries are split into parts

parameters.title: Country, or part of country, falling within one of the classical 7 continents
parameters.label: Transcontinental countries are split into parts

parameters.title: State
parameters.label: State as part of a country (countries with no states are set to country = state)

parameters.title: Province within a country
parameters.label: Provinces as part of a state

parameters.title: District within Province
parameters.label: District is an arbitrary political division used for designating regions within a province

parameters.title: Community within dstrict
parameters.label: Community is an arbitrary political division used for designating regions within a district

parameters.title: Quarter within community
parameters.label: Quarter is an arbitrary division used for designating regions within a community

parameters.title: Arbitrary spatial extent having any region of categories 0 to 11 as parentid
parameters.label: User defined but public region definition

parameters.title: Tract is a user defined region category (private or public) and can have any region of categories 0 to 11 as parentid
parameters.label: Tract is arbitrary defined by users, and can be kept private or made available for public use

parameters.title: Site is a user defined region category having tract as parentid
parameters.label: Site is arbitrary defined by users
